result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheila K Heinen

records.addlTxt:
Atty. Kautzer

Letter to Clerk of Court from Atty. Kautzer re: documents filed

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Kautzer is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $200.00 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 11/1/2022.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Scheduling conference on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Standard conditions:
Add'l conditions:
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.

3:11 PM Defendant Sheila K Heinen in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Advised of rights. Complaint received, waived reading. Court reviews charges and penalties with defendant.  Not guilty plea entered. Defendant would like counsel, does not qualify for public defender but completed a petition for appt. of counsel. Court grants appt. of counsel for a payment plan of $200/month commencing November 1st, 2022.
